title: Abseiling
summary: Abseiling (/ˈæbseɪl/ or /ˈɑːpzaɪl/; from German abseilen, 'to rope down'), also known as rappelling (/ɹæˈpɛl/ or /ɹəˈpɛl/; from French rappeler, 'to recall' or 'to pull through'), is a controlled descent off a vertical drop, such as a rock face, by descending a fixed rope.
